content.description: slab line to the right of prominent Open Face gully. Couple bolts throughout where pro placements are non existent. Allegedly led not using bolts by unknown party in 1980s according to P.Nick's guide.
content.protection:
Quickdraws for 10 bolts on the face. Newer anchors at the top, under the small ceiling, have rap chains. 

  The older, higher, bolted anchors, 12 feet from the ledge, are still there and in good shape.
content.location: slab line to the right of prominent Open Face gully

content.description: Climb the obvious chimney/gully to the top.
content.protection: Standard Rack + large gear.  Pro is scarce on this one.
content.location: At the prominent chimney/gully in the center of the Open Face.

content.description:
The first technical climb done at Stover by Joe Walsh and friends from the Philadelphia Trail Club. 

  Climb the obvious chimney on the right side of the Open Face to the top.
content.protection:
Standard rack, plus some big stuff. 

  This route now has bolts at the top, so it's topropeable.
content.location: At the chimney on the ridght side of the Open Face.

content.description:
Open Face is a tall (100 feet) open section of rock split by a large chimney/gash in the middle (Open Face, 5.5 R) and separated from the Orangutan Buttress to the right by another chimney (The Long Chimney, 5.3). Dandy Line (5.8) splits off from the Long Chimney part way up, and finishes to the right at the top left corner of Orangutan Buttress. 

  Be careful if climbing here; it is a popular spot for rapelling.
